  12:29 PM
From Pia: “I am thrilled and proud to announce that SAFFEH, the startup I’ve been working on with Cosette and Christelle, won first place in the StartupScouts Accelerator’s Final Competition :star-struck::tada: We were selected as finalists in August to take part in the virtual accelerator and have been working hard in the past couple of months to move forward! And we wouldn’t have made it this far without the help of many many people, so a BIG THANK YOU goes to:
- my parents, sister Romy, and friends: you have always been my biggest support system:heart:
- the startupscouts team Munir Bilal Tudor Tarlev Dana Dara for running the program, believing in us, fueling us with knowledge and zest, and giving us the opportunity to become part of a great community of entrepreneurs, mentors (thank you Anthony!), experts and other like minded people. This is not enough to mention everything you’ve offered, taught, and helped us with during the whole program. It’s unbelievable how much one can achieve in only a couple of months!
- my fellow sprint and accelerator mates: even though it was a competition it never felt like it because we were all supporting each other, and offering valuable help and feedback. A big shout out especially to Wael and Rida :star-struck:
- Fulbright MENA Alumni: inviting me to participate in the alumni panel last march at the reentry workshop gave me the chance to meet my dear friend and co-founder Cosette!
- all the people who participated in our cocreation workshop, filled our survey, or simply offered us in person feedback or advice
- our beta users!
- all the organizers, partners and funders of the program AltCity, Summer of Innovation, Alfa Telecommunications: launching this virtual accelerator empowers people like me with a full-time job, or students, or anyone else to chase after their ideas and work on them. It more importantly allows young lebanese entrepreneurs to participate no matter where they are in Lebanon or the world, have a chance to contribute to the country, and maybe even come back to it. I am proud to say that Saffeh was driven by a remote team with cosette and Christelle being abroad!
Excited for what lies ahead! This is only the beginning! :star-struck::muscle:
”
David Munir Nabti

How you guys facilitate stuff has been an inspiration since before the Sprint, the energy is different. And we're trying to integrate that into our own way of doing work. Content can be created at any moment, but a well-structured team, project management skills and that "spirit" or "attitude" of working are the most important things we're trying to learn and build in this accelerator!- Marwa Ammar, Academic Mentor Program

What could be interesting is to assign monthly calls for a 4 month program to PM’s as a part of their process and a digest form for responsiveness.
A suggestion, we can take a similar process we ask the teams for the program managesr. After taking calls and filling out this form we can ask the PM (in our case Dara) to fill out a form like this to digest insights into something she can share with Bloom and the Program Manager team so she can identify her Action Plan to improve the program month on month. https://airtable.com/shrHQuZNgnYJXfzCP
I’d love it if you had time to digest your lessons Dara in the form above. Also, if anyone would like to edit the form’s questions: https://airtable.com/tblt0aFgIsql8VvxD/viwS98ViNw6ljZ54A?blocks=hide
(Do we have the dimensions a Program Manager works on defined in OAK? I was thinking it would be good to self rank where the Program Stands on the following: Mentorship
Engagement and accountability
Practical activities
And inspiration
I feel like perhaps I’m missing one.
The idea is if we reflect on how we’re doing on the following dimensions, do a 1% better style reflection exercise and create goals and action plans the Program will improve Month on Month AND OAK will improve at the same time as we’ll get insights from all Program Managers.
I’d love your thoughts on this process for #1_0_programs-feedback thanks guys! :)AirtableAirtable

Great points BG ... and great idea that maybe we can help. Help people have opportunities for recharging, breaks, "retreats", etc. Even in our remote-focused efforts ... or perhaps especially with that. I can imagine for example that we take over a place like Maison de la Foret for a few days (a week?) and get people all together, of the teams and abroad, and have a retreat of sorts.
http://www.lamaisondelaforet.net/en/Home
I like that place because we can all be together but separate ... separate cabins, so "safer". As long as people are safe within them.
Zeina and I are going to a meditation retreat in mid-Jan that is requiring everyone to do a PCR test 4 days before the event. Could do that as well. (edited)

These testimonials have been added based on the text provided in your message. Please note that the feedback listed above is from the participants and mentors of Bloom's programs, as per your request.

Can you find great quotes from teams about Bloom's programs from this list of feedback from teams? 
Mohammad Al-Omari
Project Director - JORDAN Youth Innovation Forum
About the ACAT diagnostic
To be honest, the diagnostic sessions helped us rearrange our thoughts on developing our organization’s policies and structure. It gave us a better insight on how to reflect a better image of our work. This came handy once we started our large initiative to “reinvent the organization”, an initiative to update our policies, mission statement, and processes, and to make sure they are aligned with our activities.
The result was amazing, thanks for the team at Pitchworthy, especially Carol, who dedicated her time to help us analyze our strengths and weaknesses, and enhance our work accordingly. You can find attached our new organization profile, as a sample document resulting from this initiative.
Mohammad Al-Omari
Project Director
JORDAN Youth Innovation Forum
7th Circle, Opposite Royal Jordanian and the Arab Bank,
Ayman Al Malkh Building, Office 306 (3rd floor)
Jordan Youth Innovation Forum
Amman, Jordan (edited)

Dara
  10:57 AM
Shared with Nour for social already, sharing here for all the feels :white_heart:
Little Melly: I’ve been a part of so many entrepreneurship programs, and this is hands down one of the best executed. Thanks
Ptibisou: I was finally doing my first pitch ever, my first presentation, and my first screen sharing ever, and it actually went better than expected.
OODA: The growing sense of community from day 1! It went beyond my expectations.
Mortben: It is incredible how we can generate hundreds of solutions in just a little time; we need this community in our daily life.
Kawa Fungo: All teams are excellent. The vibe is very positive.
Le Joyau d’Olive: The ECAT did open up my eyes to a lot of things. For example, although I knew I had these problems when I wrote them down and shared them with the team and heard their feedback, I completely understood that those are things I should be taking seriously and solving ASAP.
Wonderhub: The energy and engagement of the other teams to support were incredible; I will surely be missing all this interaction once the sprint is over! 
Hadiyati: Such a great and amazing Bloom Team and Program! Being part of the 2 weeks sprint was a great opportunity for us to learn, share and brainstorm ideas with a great community with bright ideas, which proves once again that we, Lebanese people, will always strive and shine despite all circumstances. Thank you for the Bloom team! A great, professional, fun, and motivated team that spreads positivity all around
:heart_eyes:

Feedback from WordWave-Lama Eid - ACSI2 Sprint Team :rocket::sunflower::blue_heart::
Hello,
Thank you bloom team for all the effort and time. I can't but say you are beautiful people with beautiful energy!
The WordWave team is lucky to be part of this program.For us, we are still at the very beginning and the sprint phase guided us and pushed us to progress faster and in a more goal oriented way.The progress we did for our startup is very valuable and we will always remember the bloom team as the one who supported us and believed in our mission and vision in our early stages..
Sharing our ideas with people with the same mindset , with future entrepreneurs is very encouraging and uplifting given the situation we are going through in lebanon.We learn and inspire each other to follow our passion and initiate what we think will have an impact on everyone around us.
And ofcourse a big thanks to the mentors for their prompt advice and guidance
We are grateful for this opportunity and we will be more than happy if chosen for the accelerator program, and if not, we hope to cross paths in future programs :)
Best,
Lama

.Message 1_0_programs-feedback

Here are some great quotes from teams about Bloom's programs:

1. From Mohammad Al-Omari, Project Director - JORDAN Youth Innovation Forum: "The diagnostic sessions helped us rearrange our thoughts on developing our organization’s policies and structure. It gave us a better insight on how to reflect a better image of our work."

2. From Little Melly: "I’ve been a part of so many entrepreneurship programs, and this is hands down one of the best executed."

3. From Le Joyau d’Olive: "The ECAT did open up my eyes to a lot of things. For example, although I knew I had these problems when I wrote them down and shared them with the team and heard their feedback, I completely understood that those are things I should be taking seriously and solving ASAP."

4. From Hadiyati: "Such a great and amazing Bloom Team and Program! Being part of the 2 weeks sprint was a great opportunity for us to learn, share and brainstorm ideas with a great community with bright ideas, which proves once again that we, Lebanese people, will always strive and shine despite all circumstances. Thank you for the Bloom team!"

5. From Ogechi: "The mindset of sharing: giving and receiving is a striking feature. The culture of we grow together is what I am taking."

6. From Lama Eid, WordWave Team: "The progress we did for our startup is very valuable and we will always remember the bloom team as the one who supported us and believed in our mission and vision in our early stages."

7. From Sara ElKoussa, CancerCom Team: "I want to thank the bloom community for creating a healthy environment for interaction, growth, and, better yet, failure. I've never experienced a BootCamp like this before. Please keep doing what you're doing; you're great at doing it!"
